See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"harvest(address)":{"params":{"to":"Receiver of RARA rewards."}},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"pendingReward(address)":{"params":{"_user":"Address of user."},"returns":{"pending":"Rara reward for a given user."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"setBurnRate(uint256,uint256,address,bool)":{"params":{"_burnAddress":"Address of the burner; the indicated Rara proportion will be transferred here (e.g. 0x0).","_denominator":"The share of all Rara out of which {_numerator} is burned. e.g. _numerator = 5, _denominator = 100 will burn 5%.","_numerator":"The share of emitted Rara to burn","overwrite":"True if the _burnAddress should be set. Otherwise, `_burnAddress` is ignored."}},"setPoolActivation(uint256,uint256,address,uint256,bool,uint256)":{"params":{"_amount":"The number of the \"activation\" token which must be burned.","_pid":"The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.","_tokenPower":"Mining hashpower of a single activated token instance."}},"setUnlockBlock(uint256)":{"params":{"_block":"The block at which to unlock harvesting."}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"addPool(address,uint256,bool,uint256)":{"notice":"Add a new collectible token to the pool."},"batch(bytes[],bool)":{"notice":"Allows batched call to self (this contract)."},"burnAddress()":{"notice":"Burn address (address to receive burned Rara -- 0x0 default)"},"burnDenominator()":{"notice":"Burn quantity (denominator of a fraction)"},"burnNumerator()":{"notice":"Burn quantity (numerator of a fraction)"},"emitter()":{"notice":"Address of RARA emitter."},"harvest(address)":{"notice":"Harvest proceeds for transaction sender to `to`."},"initialize()":{"notice":"Initialize the mining process, starting the first Period based on current settings. Once called, will attempt to record mining periods continuously (long waits between transactions and/or changes to period durations may introduce gaps); until this function is called, however, no deposits are possible."},"pendingReward(address)":{"notice":"View function to see pending Rara on frontend."},"periodInfo(uint256)":{"notice":"Info on mining periods. We attempt mining over a timeframe, but because we can only actually change periods during a transaction, we mark these events by blocks."},"permitToken(address,address,address,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"notice":"Call wrapper that performs `ERC20.permit` on `token`. This `tokenId` can be used in tokenInfo[tAddress][tokenId]."},"rara()":{"notice":"Address of RARA token contract."},"registry()":{"notice":"Address of voting level registry (provides power multipliers)"},"setBurnRate(uint256,uint256,address,bool)":{"notice":"Safely update the Rara burn rate."},"setPoolActivation(uint256,uint256,address,uint256,bool,uint256)":{"notice":"Update the given pool's activation requirements: the type of token, and quantity, which must be provided to \"activate\" one instance of the staked token. documentation.text: @notice Address of RARA token contract.
@notice Address of RARA emitter.
@notice Address of voting level registry (provides power multipliers)
@notice Info of each RCM pool.
@notice Info of each user (not divided between pools)
@notice Info of each token by address and ID

@notice Enemurability for tokens staked by user into pools.
 For pool p, user u, poolUserTokenIndex[p][u].length gives the number of
 tokens invested, and poolUserTokenIndex[p][u][i] the tokenId of the 'i'th
 such token. This `tokenId` can be used in tokenInfo[tAddress][tokenId].
@notice Rara accumulates, but cannot be harvested before this block
@notice Burn quantity (numerator of a fraction)
@notice Burn quantity (denominator of a fraction)
@notice Burn address (address to receive burned Rara -- 0x0 default)

@param _rara The RaraToken address
 @param _emitter The RaraEmitter address

documentation.text:
@notice Initialize the mining process, starting the first Period based
 on current settings. Once called, will attempt to record mining periods
 continuously (long waits between transactions and/or changes to period
 durations may introduce gaps); until this function is called, however, no
 deposits are possible.

documentation.text:
@notice Harvest proceeds for transaction sender to `to`.
 @param to Receiver of RARA rewards.

params._tokenPower: The amount of mining hashpower granted for instance of this token
params._tokenType: If `_typed`, this is the {tokenType} which must be deposited.
params._typed: Whether this token is typed (IERC721Collectible) *AND* a particular type is of interest, i.e. if a particular {tokenType} must be deposited to earn any Rara.

params.calls: An array of inputs for each call.
params.revertOnFail: If True then reverts after a failed call and stops doing further calls.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

returns.pending: Rara reward for a given user.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._burnAddress: Address of the burner; the indicated Rara proportion will be transferred here (e.g. 0x0).
params._denominator: The share of all Rara out of which {_numerator} is burned. e.g. _numerator = 5, _denominator = 100 will burn 5%.
params._numerator: The share of emitted Rara to burn
params.overwrite: True if the _burnAddress should be set. Otherwise, `_burnAddress` is ignored.

params._amount: The number of the "activation" token which must be burned.
params._pid: The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.
params._power: Mining hashpower of a single activated token instance.
params._token: Token address of the "activation" token which must be burned to activate a staked token.
params._tokenType: if `_typed`, the {tokenType} which must be burned.
params._typed: Whether the activation token implements IERC721Collectible *AND* a particular {tokenType} must be burned.

params._pid: The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.
params._tokenPower: Mining hashpower of a single activated token instance.

params._block: The block at which to unlock harvesting.

addPool(address,uint256,bool,uint256).notice: Add a new collectible token to the pool.

batch(bytes[],bool).notice: Allows batched call to self (this contract).

burnAddress().notice: Burn address (address to receive burned Rara -- 0x0 default)

harvest(address).notice: Harvest proceeds for transaction sender to `to`.

initialize().notice: Initialize the mining process, starting the first Period based on current settings. Once called, will attempt to record mining periods continuously (long waits between transactions and/or changes to period durations may introduce gaps); until this function is called, however, no deposits are possible.

pendingReward(address).notice: View function to see pending Rara on frontend.

periodInfo(uint256).notice: Info on mining periods. We attempt mining over a timeframe, but because we can only actually change periods during a transaction, we mark these events by blocks.

permitToken(address,address,address,uint.notice: Call wrapper that performs `ERC20.permit` on `token`. Lookup `IPermitERC20.permit`.

poolLength().notice: Returns the number of RMP pools.

poolUserTokenIndex(uint256,address,uint2.notice: Enemurability for tokens staked by user into pools. For pool p, user u, poolUserTokenIndex[p][u].length gives the number of tokens invested, and poolUserTokenIndex[p][u][i] the tokenId of the 'i'th such token. This `tokenId` can be used in tokenInfo[tAddress][tokenId].

registry().notice: Address of voting level registry (provides power multipliers)

setBurnRate(uint256,uint256,address,bool.notice: Safely update the Rara burn rate.

setPoolActivation(uint256,uint256,addres.notice: Update the given pool's activation requirements: the type of token, and quantity, which must be provided to "activate" one instance of the staked token. Also sets the resulting mining hashpower generated by a single activated token.

setPoolPower(uint256,uint256).notice: Update the given pool's tokenPower: the amount of mining hashpower generated by a single activated token.

setUnlockBlock(uint256).notice: Set the `unlockBlock`; the block after which mined Rara can be harvested. Can only be called by the manager, and only before the current unlockBlock.

tokenInfo(address,uint256).notice: Info of each token by address and ID

unlockBlock().notice: Rara accumulates, but cannot be harvested before this block

userInfo(address).notice: Info of each user (not divided between pools)
